resources.string: The version of Peek included with your ROM has been disabled to prevent conflict with this app.
Peek requires the notification listener service to work.\n\nEnable it to begin.
If you have enabled notification listener service already, please reboot your phone.
Allow Peek to turn your screen off
Peek won\'t be able to turn off your screen!
Swipe right to dismiss the notification
Tap and hold to show more information
Swipe up to expand the notification
Swipe down to open the app
Place your device on a flat surface and click Ok. Lift it up after you hear the notification sound.
Display your notifications upon waking your device
Don\'t display your notifications upon waking your device
Hide navigation bar while displaying notifications
Show navigation bar while displaying notifications
The background behind notifications is black
The background behind notifications is your current wallpaper
Swipe left to dismiss notification, swipe right to unlock
Swipe left to unlock, swipe right to dismiss notification
Time on seconds that the display stays on after a notification has been shown
Show system apps on blacklist grid
Hide system apps from blacklist grid
Screen will turn on when receiving a notification
Screen won\'t turn on when receiving a notification

Battery saving: when receiving a notification, Peek will start to detect motion for a fixed amount of seconds, specified by the user. After this time, they will stop polling to save battery.

Always active: the sensors are permanently being polled for motion changes after a notification until you read it. It consumes more battery because it needs to keep the CPU active.

Always active while charging: same as above but only during charging times. When device is not charging, it uses the battery saving scheme.
Using always active mode may cause high battery drain. If you face this issue, please use either battery saving or active while charging modes.
Sensors will keep working this time in seconds. Bigger values mean more battery drain
Calibrate and adjust sensors for in-pocket and motion detection

To ensure the best experience we recommend that you calibrate the proximity and motion sensors.

Do you want to adjust them now?
(You can perform this process later in settings).
Sensors will be calibrated and adjusted to ensure proper functionality of the application. This process can\'t be canceled, continue?
Place your device on a flat surface and press next.
Lift your device and press next.
Cover the proximity sensor with your hand and press next.
Notification title will be displayed in secure lock screen
Notification title won\'t be displayed in secure lock screen
Notification content will be displayed in secure lock screen
Notification content won\'t be displayed in secure lock screen

When you receive a notification, and screen is off, sensor polling will start. If some movement is detected on your device (either it was on a table and you lifted it, or it was in your pocket and you got it out), Peek will show. Sensors will be polled for 10 seconds (by default, customizable) and then it stops doing so, to save battery. It is not possible to simulate the behavior of devices like the Moto X, without affecting battery, since they have special hardware for the task.
Please enable notification listener for Peek on settings
Do you like Peek? Rate it!
This application is not licensed. Please purchase it from Google\'s Play Store.
